title: T058: Unit test for token validation with mocked JWKS
description:
## Task T058

**Phase**: 6 - US4 OAuth2/OIDC Authentication
**User Story**: US4 - OAuth2/OIDC Authentication (P1)
**Parallel**: Yes \[P\]

### Description

Unit test for token validation with mocked JWKS in plugins/floe-identity-keycloak/tests/unit/test_token_validation.py

### Test Cases

* Valid token returns valid=True with user info
* Expired token returns valid=False with error
* Invalid signature returns valid=False
* Missing claims returns valid=False
* JWKS cache hit (no fetch)
* JWKS cache miss (fetch from endpoint)

### File(s)

`plugins/floe-identity-keycloak/tests/unit/test_token_validation.py`

### Requirements

* FR-034: KeycloakPlugin MUST validate JWT tokens using JWKS
* SC-005: Token validation latency under 50ms with cached JWKS

### Links

* [Spec](https://github.com/Obsidian-Owl/floe/blob/main/specs/7a-identity-secrets/spec.md)

title: T043: Integrate circuit breaker with OCIClient
description:
## Task

\[US5\] Integrate circuit breaker with OCIClient in `packages/floe-core/src/floe_core/oci/client.py`.

**Implementation**:

* Wrap all registry operations with circuit breaker check
* Raise CircuitBreakerOpenError when circuit is open
* Record success/failure for state transitions

**Requirements covered**: FR-019, FR-020

**Implementation notes**:

* Check circuit state before every registry operation
* Fail fast when open (no network call)
* Allow single probe request in half-open state
* Close circuit on successful probe

**Phase**: 7 (User Story 5 - Resilient Operations)
**Priority**: P2

title: T017: Implement push operation in OCIClient
description:
## Task

\[US1\] Implement push operation in `packages/floe-core/src/floe_core/oci/client.py`.

**Implementation**:

* `OCIClient.push()` method using ORAS SDK
* Serialize CompiledArtifacts using [manifest.py](http://manifest.py) functions
* Push layer blob and manifest to registry
* Return digest on success

**Requirements covered**: FR-001, FR-035

**Implementation notes**:

* Use `build_manifest()` and `serialize_layer()` from [manifest.py](http://manifest.py)
* Use ORAS SDK for registry operations
* Apply resilience patterns (retry, circuit breaker)
* Emit OpenTelemetry metrics

**Phase**: 3 (User Story 1 - Push Compiled Artifacts)
**Priority**: P1 MVP

title: T053: Add integration-tests job with Kind cluster to .github/workflows/ci.yml
description:
## Phase 7: User Story 5

Add integration tests job with Kind cluster to CI workflow.

### File

`.github/workflows/ci.yml`

### Job

```yaml
integration-tests:
  needs: [unit-tests, security]
  runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  steps:
    - uses: helm/kind-action@v1
      with:
        cluster_name: floe-test
        config: testing/k8s/kind-config.yaml
    - name: Deploy services
      run: kubectl apply -f testing/k8s/services/
    - name: Wait for services
      run: kubectl wait --for=condition=ready pods --all -n floe-test
    - name: Run integration tests
      run: make test-integration
```

### Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Integration tests job added
- [ ] Kind cluster created
- [ ] Services deployed
- [ ] Tests run as K8s Jobs
- [ ] Artifacts collected on failure

### Spec Reference

* Feature: 9c-testing-infra
* Phase: 7 (US5)
* FR-022: System MUST add integration-tests job

title: T051: Implement list_secrets() with path prefix filtering
description:
## Task T051

**Phase**: 5 - US3 Infisical Secrets Backend
**User Story**: US3 - Infisical Secrets Backend (P1)
**Parallel**: No

### Description

Implement list_secrets() with path prefix filtering in plugins/floe-secrets-infisical/src/floe_secrets_infisical/plugin.py

### Implementation

```python
def list_secrets(self, prefix: str = "") -> list[str]:
    secrets = self._client.secrets.list_secrets(
        project_id=self._config.project_id,
        environment_slug=self._config.environment,
        secret_path=self._config.path
    )
    if prefix:
        return [s.secret_key for s in secrets if s.secret_key.startswith(prefix)]
    return [s.secret_key for s in secrets]
```

### File(s)

`plugins/floe-secrets-infisical/src/floe_secrets_infisical/plugin.py`

### Requirements

* FR-002: list_secrets() with prefix filter

### Links

* [Spec](https://github.com/Obsidian-Owl/floe/blob/main/specs/7a-identity-secrets/spec.md)

title: T067: Implement get_user_info() from token claims
description:
## Task T067

**Phase**: 6 - US4 OAuth2/OIDC Authentication
**User Story**: US4 - OAuth2/OIDC Authentication (P1)
**Parallel**: No

### Description

Implement get_user_info() from token claims in plugins/floe-identity-keycloak/src/floe_identity_keycloak/plugin.py

### Implementation

```python
def get_user_info(self, token: str) -> UserInfo:
    # Decode token without verification (get_user_info is for claims extraction)
    claims = jwt.decode(token, options={"verify_signature": False})
    
    return UserInfo(
        subject=claims["sub"],
        email=claims.get("email"),
        name=claims.get("name"),
        roles=claims.get("realm_access", {}).get("roles", []),
        groups=claims.get("groups", []),
        claims=claims
    )
```

### File(s)

`plugins/floe-identity-keycloak/src/floe_identity_keycloak/plugin.py`

### Requirements

* FR-001: IdentityPlugin ABC with get_user_info()
* FR-042: UserInfo dataclass

### Links

* [Spec](https://github.com/Obsidian-Owl/floe/blob/main/specs/7a-identity-secrets/spec.md)

```python
class IntegrationTestBase:

    Provides:
    - Service availability checks
    - Unique namespace generation
    - Setup/teardown with resource cleanup
    
    Usage:
        class TestMyCatalog(IntegrationTestBase):
            required_services = [("polaris", 8181), ("minio", 9000)]
            
            def test_create_catalog(self) -> None:
                namespace = self.generate_unique_namespace("test")
                ...
    """
    required_services: list[tuple[str, int]] = []
```

description:

### Description

```python
def generate_pod_env_spec(self, secret_name: str) -> dict[str, Any]:
    return {
        "envFrom": [{"secretRef": {"name": secret_name}}]
    }
```

### File(s)

`plugins/floe-secrets-k8s/src/floe_secrets_k8s/plugin.py`

### Requirements

* FR-012: K8sSecretsPlugin MUST generate pod spec fragments with `envFrom: secretRef`

### Links

* [Spec](https://github.com/Obsidian-Owl/floe/blob/main/specs/7a-identity-secrets/spec.md)

title: [Tech Debt] Decompose PolicyEnforcer (811 lines) using Chain of Responsibility
description:
## Problem

PolicyEnforcer at 811 lines orchestrates 5 validators plus override handling in a single module. This makes testing and modification difficult.

## Proposed Decomposition

Use Chain of Responsibility pattern:

* `enforcement/validator_chain.py`: ValidatorChain orchestration
* `enforcement/override_resolver.py`: Override processing
* `enforcement/impact_analyzer.py`: Downstream impact computation
* `enforcement/policy_enforcer.py`: Simple facade

## Reference

Epic 12B plugin_registry decomposition pattern successfully reduced complexity using similar modular approach.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Each module ≤ 250 lines
- [ ] PolicyEnforcer becomes thin facade
- [ ] Validators independently testable
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] No public API changes

title: [Tech Debt] Decompose OCIClient (1,335 lines) into focused modules
description:
## Problem

OCIClient at 1,335 lines violates Single Responsibility Principle. The class handles push, pull, inspect, list, authentication, caching, and error handling all in one module.

## Proposed Decomposition

Break into focused modules following separation of concerns:

* `oci/push.py`: PushOperations (push, \_prepare_layers, \_upload_manifest)
* `oci/pull.py`: PullOperations (pull, \_download_layers, \_parse_manifest)
* `oci/inspect.py`: InspectionOperations (inspect, list, \_get_tags)
* `oci/client.py`: Thin coordinator delegating to above

## Reference

- [ ] OCIClient becomes thin facade
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] No public API changes

title: T074: Create Keycloak test deployment manifest
description:
## Task T074

**Phase**: 6 - US4 OAuth2/OIDC Authentication
**User Story**: US4 - OAuth2/OIDC Authentication (P1)
**Parallel**: No

### Description

Create Keycloak test deployment manifest in testing/k8s/services/keycloak.yaml

### Manifest Contents

* Keycloak deployment (development mode)
* Service for internal access
* ConfigMap with realm configuration
* Test user and client creation

### Example

```yaml
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: keycloak
  namespace: floe-test
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: keycloak
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: keycloak
    spec:
      containers:
      - name: keycloak
        image: quay.io/keycloak/keycloak:24.0
        args: ["start-dev"]
        env:
        - name: KEYCLOAK_ADMIN
          value: admin
        - name: KEYCLOAK_ADMIN_PASSWORD
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              name: keycloak-admin
              key: password
```

### File(s)

`testing/k8s/services/keycloak.yaml`

### Requirements

* Keycloak 24.0+ per ADR-0024

### Links

* [Spec](https://github.com/Obsidian-Owl/floe/blob/main/specs/7a-identity-secrets/spec.md)

title: T069: Implement get_oidc_config() returning OIDCConfig
description:
## Task T069

**Phase**: 6 - US4 OAuth2/OIDC Authentication
**User Story**: US4 - OAuth2/OIDC Authentication (P1)
**Parallel**: No

### Description

Implement get_oidc_config() returning OIDCConfig in plugins/floe-identity-keycloak/src/floe_identity_keycloak/plugin.py

### Implementation

```python
def get_oidc_config(self, realm: str | None = None) -> OIDCConfig:
    realm = realm or self._config.realm
    base_url = f"{self._config.server_url}/realms/{realm}"
    
    return OIDCConfig(
        discovery_url=f"{base_url}/.well-known/openid-configuration",
        jwks_uri=f"{base_url}/protocol/openid-connect/certs",
        authorization_endpoint=f"{base_url}/protocol/openid-connect/auth",
        token_endpoint=f"{base_url}/protocol/openid-connect/token",
        userinfo_endpoint=f"{base_url}/protocol/openid-connect/userinfo"
    )
```

### File(s)

`plugins/floe-identity-keycloak/src/floe_identity_keycloak/plugin.py`

### Requirements

* FR-031: KeycloakPlugin MUST return valid OIDCConfig

### Links

* [Spec](https://github.com/Obsidian-Owl/floe/blob/main/specs/7a-identity-secrets/spec.md)

title: T009: Implement wait_for_condition() in testing/fixtures/polling.py
description:
## Phase 2: Foundational (Blocking Prerequisites)

Implement `wait_for_condition()` polling utility.

### File

`testing/fixtures/polling.py`

### Function Signature

```python
def wait_for_condition(
    condition: Callable[[], bool],
    timeout: float = 30.0,
    interval: float = 0.5,
    description: str = "condition"
) -> bool:
    """Poll until condition is True or timeout.
    
    Args:
        condition: Callable returning True when ready
        timeout: Max wait time in seconds
        interval: Poll interval in seconds
        description: Description for error messages
        
    Returns:
        True if condition met, False if timeout
        
    Raises:
        TimeoutError: If condition not met within timeout
    """
```

### Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Polls at specified interval
- [ ] Returns True when condition met
- [ ] Raises TimeoutError with clear message on timeout
- [ ] NO time.sleep() hardcoded anywhere

### Spec Reference

* Feature: 9c-testing-infra
* Phase: 2 (Foundational)
* FR-015: System MUST provide wait_for_condition() polling utility
* FR-017: System MUST NOT use hardcoded time.sleep()

title: T034: Implement `floe artifact inspect` CLI command
description:
## Task

* Accept `--tag` (target tag to inspect)
* Display: digest, artifact type, size, creation timestamp, product info, signature status
* Read registry configuration from manifest.yaml

**Requirements covered**: FR-028

**CLI examples**:

```bash
floe artifact inspect --tag v1.0.0
```

**Output format**:

```
Digest:       sha256:def456...
Artifact Type: application/vnd.floe.compiled-artifacts.v1+json
Size:         12.3 KB
Created:      2026-01-19T10:30:00Z
Product:      my-data-product v1.0.0
Signature:    unsigned
```

T013: Add unit tests for namespace generation
description:
## Phase 2: Foundational \[P - Parallelizable\]

Add unit tests for namespace utilities in `testing/tests/unit/test_namespaces.py`.

### File

`testing/tests/unit/test_namespaces.py`

### Test Cases

```python
@pytest.mark.requirement("9c-FR-008")
def test_generate_unique_namespace_uniqueness() -> None:
    """Test that each call generates unique namespace."""
    ns1 = generate_unique_namespace("test")
    ns2 = generate_unique_namespace("test")
    assert ns1 != ns2

@pytest.mark.requirement("9c-FR-008")
def test_generate_unique_namespace_k8s_valid() -> None:
    """Test namespace follows K8s naming rules."""
    ns = generate_unique_namespace("test_prefix")
    assert len(ns) <= 63
    assert ns.islower()
    assert all(c.isalnum() or c == "-" for c in ns)
```

### Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] All tests have @pytest.mark.requirement() markers
- [ ] Uniqueness tested
- [ ] K8s naming rules tested
- [ ] Edge cases (long prefix) tested

### Spec Reference

* Feature: 9c-testing-infra
* Phase: 2 (Foundational)
* Parallel: Yes

title: T059: Add grep check for time.sleep in CI to ensure no hardcoded sleeps
description:
## Phase 8: User Story 6 - Polling Utilities (P1)

Add grep check for hardcoded sleeps in CI.

### Implementation

```bash
# In CI workflow
- name: Check for hardcoded sleeps
  run: |
    if grep -r "time\.sleep(" tests/ testing/; then
      echo "ERROR: Found hardcoded time.sleep() in test code"
      exit 1
    fi
```

### Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Grep check added to CI
- [ ] Fails if time.sleep found in tests
- [ ] Clear error message

### Spec Reference

* Feature: 9c-testing-infra

title: T019: [US1] Implement circular dependency detection (FLOE-E302)
description:
**Task ID**: T019
**Phase**: 3 - User Story 1 (Semantic Validation)
**User Story**: US1 - Semantic Model Validation (P1)
**Parallel**: No
**Requirements**: FR-002, FR-004

## Description

Implement circular dependency detection (FLOE-E302) using Kahn's algorithm in packages/floe-core/src/floe_core/enforcement/validators/semantic.py

## File Path

`packages/floe-core/src/floe_core/enforcement/validators/semantic.py`

## Acceptance Criteria

* Detect cycles in model dependency graph
* Use Kahn's algorithm (topological sort)
* Generate FLOE-E302 for each cycle found

title: T018: Add immutability check in push operation
description:
## Task

\[US1\] Add immutability check in push operation.

**Implementation**:

* Detect existing semver tags before push (pattern: `v[0-9]+.[0-9]+.[0-9]+`)
* Raise `ImmutabilityViolationError` if tag exists
* Allow pushes to mutable tags: `latest-*`, `dev-*`, `snapshot-*`, or non-semver tags

**Requirements covered**: FR-010, FR-011, FR-012

**Implementation notes**:

* Client-side enforcement when registry-side immutability cannot be detected
* Check for existing tags before push
* Fail fast with clear error message

**Phase**: 3 (User Story 1 - Push Compiled Artifacts)
**Priority**: P1 MVP

title: T058: Add cloud provider token refresh logic
description:

* Implement `refresh_if_needed()` for AWSIRSAAuthProvider
* Implement `refresh_if_needed()` for AzureMIAuthProvider
* Implement `refresh_if_needed()` for GCPWIAuthProvider
* Add expiry detection for each provider

**Requirements covered**: FR-009

**Implementation notes**:

* Check token expiry before each operation
* Refresh proactively (e.g., 5 minutes before expiry)
* Cache tokens to minimize API calls
* Handle refresh failures gracefully

**Phase**: 9 (User Story 7 - Multi-Registry Authentication)
**Priority**: P3

* Apply RetryPolicy from [resilience.py](http://resilience.py) to pull operation
* Exponential backoff: 1s, 2s, 4s (default 3 attempts)
* Retry on transient failures only (network errors, 5xx responses)

**Requirements covered**: FR-018

**Implementation notes**:

* Use decorator pattern for clean integration
* Add jitter to prevent thundering herd
* Do NOT retry on 4xx errors (client errors)

**Phase**: 4 (User Story 2 - Pull Artifacts)
**Priority**: P1 MVP

title: Extend CI workflow with security and integration tests
description:
## REQ-658: GitHub Actions CI Workflow Update (CRITICAL)

**UPDATE** the existing `.github/workflows/ci.yml` to add Stage 2 integration testing.

### Existing CI (Stage 1 - COMPLETE)

The current `ci.yml` already implements Stage 1 Foundation:

| Job | Status | Description |
| -- | -- | -- |
| **lint-typecheck** | ✅ Done | Ruff, mypy --strict |
| **unit-tests** | ✅ Done | Matrix (3.10, 3.11, 3.12), 80% coverage |
| **contract-tests** | ✅ Done | Cross-package contracts |
| **sonarcloud** | ✅ Done | Quality analysis + coverage |
| **ci-success** | ✅ Done | Branch protection gate |

See `.github/CI.md` for full documentation.

### New Jobs Required (Stage 2 - THIS TASK)

Add to existing `ci.yml`:

1. **security** - Bandit security scan, pip-audit CVE check
2. **integration-tests** - Kind cluster setup + real service tests
3. **e2e-tests** (optional) - Full workflow validation

### Workflow Changes

```yaml
# Add security job (parallel with unit-tests)
security:
  name: Security Scan
  runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  needs: lint-typecheck
  steps:
    - name: Run Bandit
      run: uv run bandit -r packages/ -ll
    - name: Run pip-audit
      run: uv run pip-audit

# Add integration-tests job (requires Kind cluster)
integration-tests:
  name: Integration Tests
  runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  needs: [lint-typecheck, security]
  steps:
    - name: Create Kind cluster
      uses: helm/kind-action@...
    - name: Deploy test services
      run: kubectl apply -f testing/k8s/services/
    - name: Run integration tests
      run: make test-integration

# Update ci-success to include new jobs
```

### File

`.github/workflows/ci.yml` (UPDATE existing, not new file)

### Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Security job added (Bandit + pip-audit)
- [ ] Integration tests job with Kind cluster
- [ ] Test services deployed via raw K8s manifests
- [ ] ci-success gate updated to include new jobs
- [ ] Parallel job execution where possible
- [ ] Coverage for integration tests uploaded

### Dependencies

* **Blocks**: All other integration testing
* **Depends on**: FLO-427 (K8s service manifests), FLO-428 (Makefile targets)

title: T049: Implement get_secret() with path-based organization
description:
## Task T049

**Phase**: 5 - US3 Infisical Secrets Backend
**User Story**: US3 - Infisical Secrets Backend (P1)
**Parallel**: No

### Description

Implement get_secret() with path-based organization in plugins/floe-secrets-infisical/src/floe_secrets_infisical/plugin.py

### Path Organization

Infisical uses path-based organization:

* `/compute/snowflake/password`
* `/catalog/polaris/token`

### Implementation

```python
def get_secret(self, key: str) -> str | None:
    # key format: "secret-name" (uses config.path) or "/full/path/secret-name"
    secret = self._client.secrets.get_secret_by_name(
        secret_name=secret_name,
        project_id=self._config.project_id,
        environment_slug=self._config.environment,
        secret_path=path
    )
    return secret.secret_value if secret else None
```

### File(s)

`plugins/floe-secrets-infisical/src/floe_secrets_infisical/plugin.py`

### Requirements

* FR-024: InfisicalSecretsPlugin MUST support path-based organization

### Links

title: T040: Add validation that no secret values appear in CompiledArtifacts
description:
## Task T040

**Phase**: 4 - US1 SecretReference Runtime Resolution
**User Story**: US1 - SecretReference Runtime Resolution (P0)
**Parallel**: No

### Description

Add validation that no secret values appear in CompiledArtifacts in packages/floe-core/src/floe_core/compiler/

### Validation Rules

1. CompiledArtifacts MUST NOT contain any field with actual secret values
2. All credential fields MUST be SecretReference or env_var() strings
3. Validation runs as final step of compilation
4. FAIL compilation if secret value detected

### Detection Patterns

* Field named "password", "secret", "api_key", "token" with non-env_var value
* Base64 encoded values that aren't env_var references

### File(s)

`packages/floe-core/src/floe_core/compiler/`

### Requirements

* SC-004: Zero secrets appear in compile output
* FR-043: System MUST NOT expose secret values in logs, error messages, or stack traces

### Links

* [Spec](https://github.com/Obsidian-Owl/floe/blob/main/specs/7a-identity-secrets/spec.md)

title: T010: Create promotion-specific exceptions
description:
**Task ID**: T010
**Phase**: Phase 1: Setup (Shared Infrastructure)
**Parallel**: No

Create promotion-specific exceptions in `packages/floe-core/src/floe_core/oci/errors.py`

* GateValidationError(OCIError): exit_code=8, attrs: gate, details
* InvalidTransitionError(OCIError): exit_code=9, attrs: from_env, to_env, reason
* TagExistsError(OCIError): exit_code=10, attrs: tag, existing_digest
* VersionNotPromotedError(OCIError): exit_code=11, attrs: tag, environment, available_versions
* AuthorizationError(OCIError): exit_code=12, attrs: operator, required_groups, reason
* EnvironmentLockedError(OCIError): exit_code=13, attrs: environment, locked_by, locked_at, reason
* NOTE: Reuse existing SignatureVerificationError (exit_code=6)

title: T048: Implement Universal Auth authentication flow
description:
## Task T048

**Phase**: 5 - US3 Infisical Secrets Backend
**User Story**: US3 - Infisical Secrets Backend (P1)
**Parallel**: No

### Description

Implement Universal Auth authentication flow in plugins/floe-secrets-infisical/src/floe_secrets_infisical/plugin.py

### Authentication Flow

1. Call `client.auth.universal_auth.login()` with client credentials
2. SDK handles token management automatically
3. Retry with backoff on token expiration
4. Raise `InfisicalAuthError` on failure

### File(s)

`plugins/floe-secrets-infisical/src/floe_secrets_infisical/plugin.py`

### Requirements

* FR-021: InfisicalSecretsPlugin MUST support Universal Auth

### Links

* [Spec](https://github.com/Obsidian-Owl/floe/blob/main/specs/7a-identity-secrets/spec.md)
* [Infisical Universal Auth Docs](https://infisical.com/docs/documentation/platform/identities/universal-auth)

title: T039: Implement `floe artifact list` CLI command
description:
## Task

\[US4\] Implement `floe artifact list` CLI command in `packages/floe-core/src/floe_core/cli/artifact.py`.

**Implementation**:

* Accept optional `--filter` (tag pattern)
* Display table: TAG, DIGEST, SIZE, CREATED
* Read registry configuration from manifest.yaml

**Requirements covered**: FR-029

**CLI examples**:

```bash
floe artifact list
floe artifact list --filter "v1.*"
```

**Output format**:


title: T010: Implement wait_for_service() in testing/fixtures/polling.py
description:
## Phase 2: Foundational (Blocking Prerequisites)

Implement `wait_for_service()` utility for service health checks.

### File

`testing/fixtures/polling.py`

### Function Signature

```python
def wait_for_service(
    service_name: str,
    port: int,
    namespace: str = "floe-test",
    timeout: float = 60.0,
    config: PollingConfig | None = None
) -> bool:
    """Wait for K8s service to become ready.
    
    Args:
        service_name: Name of the K8s service
        port: Port to check
        namespace: K8s namespace
        timeout: Max wait time in seconds
        config: Optional PollingConfig
        
    Returns:
        True if service ready
        
    Raises:
        TimeoutError: If service not ready within timeout
    """
```

### Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Checks service health via TCP connect or HTTP GET
- [ ] Uses wait_for_condition() internally
- [ ] Clear error message with service name and port on timeout

### Spec Reference

* Feature: 9c-testing-infra
* Phase: 2 (Foundational)
* FR-016: System MUST provide wait_for_service() utility

title: Epic 11: RBAC audit/validation logic migrated to floe-core
description:
## Summary

Completed migration of ALL RBAC audit/validation/diff logic from floe-cli to floe-core as part of Epic 11 (CLI Unification).

## Work Completed

### Phase 1: RBAC Logic Migration (\~1,066 lines)

**New Schema Files** (Pydantic v2, frozen models):

* `floe_core/schemas/rbac_audit.py` - AuditSeverity, AuditFindingType, AuditFinding, ServiceAccountSummary, NamespaceSummary, RBACAuditReport
* `floe_core/schemas/rbac_validation.py` - ValidationStatus, ValidationIssueType, ValidationIssue, RBACValidationResult
* `floe_core/schemas/rbac_diff.py` - DiffChangeType, ResourceDiff, RBACDiffResult

**New Function Modules**:

* `floe_core/rbac/validate.py` - validate_manifest_against_config (FR-061, FR-062)
* `floe_core/rbac/diff.py` - compute_resource_diff, compute_rbac_diff (FR-063)
* `floe_core/rbac/audit.py` - detect_wildcard_permissions, check_missing_resource_names (FR-070)

**CLI Commands Updated** (type-safe models):

* `cli/rbac/audit.py` - Uses AuditFinding, RBACAuditReport, detection functions
* `cli/rbac/validate.py` - Uses RBACValidationResult, validate_manifest_against_config
* `cli/rbac/diff.py` - Uses compute_rbac_diff, RBACDiffResult

**Tests Migrated** (90+ new tests):

* Schema model tests (38 tests)
* Function tests (52 tests)

### Phase 2: Dead Code Removal (\~6,000 lines)

* Removed `floe-cli/src/` (deprecated package)
* Removed `floe-cli/tests/` (tests migrated)
* Removed `floe-core/cli/artifact.py` (old argparse)
* Removed `floe-core/cli/compile.py` (old argparse)
* Removed `floe-core/cli/data/` (unused directory)
* Removed `test_artifact.py`, `test_compile.py` (tested deleted code)

## Requirements Addressed

* FR-061: RBAC manifest validation
* FR-062: Security audit functions
* FR-063: RBAC diff functions
* FR-070: Wildcard permission detection

## Verification

All tests pass:

* RBAC schema tests: 38 passed
* RBAC function tests: 52 passed
* CLI tests: 110 passed
* All imports verified working

title: T016: Implement init command in cli.py
description:
**Task ID**: T016
**Phase**: 3 - US1+US2 (Cognee Cloud Setup + Architecture Indexing)
**User Story**: US2
**Parallel**: No

## Description

Implement `init` command in `cli.py`:

* Load sources from config
* For each source matching architecture pattern (`docs/architecture/**/*.md`):
  * Parse markdown content
  * Call `cognee.add()` with dataset="architecture"
* Call `cognee.cognify(datasets=["architecture"])`
* Display progress (current/total files)
* Save `SyncState` to `.cognee/state.json`

## Files

* `devtools/agent-memory/src/agent_memory/cli.py`

## Acceptance Criteria

* `agent-memory init` indexes all architecture docs
* Progress displayed during indexing
* State saved for incremental sync

## Requirements

* FR-003: Provide setup command
* FR-004: Index architecture documentation

```python
class PluginTestBase(IntegrationTestBase):
    """Base class for plugin integration tests.

    - ABC compliance validation
    - Metadata validation
    - Entry point testing

    plugin_type: str  # e.g., "compute", "orchestrator"
```

title: REQ-061: TelemetryBackendPlugin Test Fixtures
description:
**Requirement ID**: REQ-061
**Priority**: HIGH
**Phase**: Integration Testing Infrastructure

## Description

Create test fixtures for OpenTelemetry integration tests that work with the K8s-native testing framework (Epic 9C).

## Deliverables

1. `testing/fixtures/telemetry.py` - TelemetryBackendPlugin test fixtures
   * `JaegerConfig` - Configuration for Jaeger tracing backend
   * `OTLPCollectorConfig` - Configuration for OTLP collector
   * `jaeger_context()` / `otlp_collector_context()` - Context managers for fixture lifecycle
   * Environment variable defaults for K8s DNS resolution
2. `testing/k8s/services/jaeger.yaml` - Jaeger K8s manifest for integration tests
   * All-in-one Jaeger deployment
   * OTLP receiver enabled
   * Query API for trace verification
3. Unit tests for fixtures in `testing/tests/unit/test_telemetry_fixtures.py`

## Pattern Reference

Follow the pattern established in:

* `testing/fixtures/polaris.py` - Config model + context manager pattern
* `testing/fixtures/services.py` - Service readiness polling

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] TelemetryConfig Pydantic model with K8s defaults
- [ ] Context manager for Jaeger lifecycle
- [ ] Polling utility for collector readiness
- [ ] Jaeger K8s manifest with OTLP receiver
- [ ] Unit tests for fixture configuration
- [ ] Integration test demonstrating trace export to Jaeger

## Dependencies

* Epic 9C K8s test infrastructure (COMPLETED - merged to main)
* OpenTelemetry SDK integration (T040-T043 COMPLETED)

title: T032: Add OpenTelemetry tracing to all secret operations
description:
## Task T032

**Phase**: 3 - US2 K8s Secrets Backend
**User Story**: US2 - Kubernetes Secrets Backend (P0)
**Parallel**: No

### Description

Add OpenTelemetry tracing to all secret operations in plugins/floe-secrets-k8s/src/floe_secrets_k8s/plugin.py

### Spans

* `k8s_secrets.get_secret` - key, namespace
* `k8s_secrets.set_secret` - key, namespace
* `k8s_secrets.list_secrets` - prefix, namespace, count

### Implementation

```python
from opentelemetry import trace

tracer = trace.get_tracer(__name__)

def get_secret(self, key: str) -> str | None:
    with tracer.start_as_current_span("k8s_secrets.get_secret") as span:
        span.set_attribute("secret.key", key)
        span.set_attribute("k8s.namespace", self._config.namespace)
        # ... implementation
```

### File(s)

`plugins/floe-secrets-k8s/src/floe_secrets_k8s/plugin.py`

### Requirements

* Principle VIII: Observability By Default

### Links

* [Spec](https://github.com/Obsidian-Owl/floe/blob/main/specs/7a-identity-secrets/spec.md)

title: T036: Implement CLI interface for python -m testing.traceability
description:
## Phase 5: User Story 3

Implement CLI interface for traceability checker.

### File

`testing/traceability/checker.py`

### CLI Interface

```bash
# Check all tests have markers
python -m testing.traceability --all --threshold 100

# Generate JSON report
python -m testing.traceability --report --output report.json

# List tests without markers
python -m testing.traceability --missing
```

### Arguments

* `--all`: Check all tests
* `--threshold`: Coverage threshold (default 100)
* `--report`: Generate full report
* `--output`: Output file path
* `--missing`: List tests without markers

### Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] CLI parses arguments correctly
- [ ] Exit code 1 if threshold not met
- [ ] JSON output option
- [ ] Clear error messages

### Spec Reference

* Feature: 9c-testing-infra

title: [Polish] Security audit: verify no hardcoded credentials
description:
**Task ID**: T079
**Phase**: Polish & Cross-Cutting Concerns

Security audit to verify no hardcoded credentials and all secrets use SecretStr.

**Verification Steps**:

1. Run `rg "password|secret|api_key|token" --type py plugins/floe-catalog-polaris/`
2. Verify all credential fields use SecretStr
3. Check no credentials in test files (use env vars)
4. Run bandit security scanner
5. Verify no secrets logged in any code path

**Checklist**:

- [ ] All password fields use SecretStr
- [ ] All API keys use SecretStr
- [ ] No hardcoded values in tests
- [ ] No credentials in log statements
- [ ] Environment variable fallbacks have safe defaults

**Acceptance Criteria**:

* bandit scan passes with no high/critical issues
* All secrets properly protected
* No credentials in git history

**Labels**: \[P\] parallelizable

title: [T100] Verify subprocess calls avoid shell=True (constitution audit)
description:
**Type**: Compliance Audit

**Task**: Verify all subprocess calls avoid shell=True (constitution VI compliance audit)

**Audit Result**: COMPLIANT ✅

**Findings**:
5 subprocess.run calls found in oci/ package:

* `signing.py:442` - Uses list `cmd`, no shell=True
* `verification.py:553` - Uses list `cmd`, no shell=True
* `attestation.py:125` - Uses inline list `["syft", ...]`, no shell=True
* `attestation.py:214` - Uses list `cmd`, no shell=True
* `attestation.py:271` - Uses inline list `["cosign", ...]`, no shell=True

No instances of:

* `shell=True` parameter
* String command concatenation for shell execution

All subprocess calls use list arguments with explicit command arrays.

**Scope**: All files in `packages/floe-core/src/floe_core/oci/`"

title: T029: Implement setup_method() and teardown_method() in IntegrationTestBase
description:
## Phase 4: User Story 2

Implement setup_method() and teardown_method() in IntegrationTestBase.

### File

`testing/base_classes/integration_test_base.py`

### Methods

```python
def setup_method(self) -> None:
    """Set up before each test method.
    
    - Checks required_services availability
    - Initializes namespace tracking
    """
    
def teardown_method(self) -> None:
    """Clean up after each test method.
    
    - Deletes created namespaces
    - Cleans up test resources
    """
```

### Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] setup_method checks all required_services
- [ ] teardown_method cleans up all tracked namespaces
- [ ] Cleanup runs even if test fails
- [ ] Uses pytest hooks correctly

### Spec Reference

* Feature: 9c-testing-infra
* Phase: 4 (US2 - Base Classes)
* FR-009: Base classes MUST clean up resources after tests complete

title: T026: Add auto-detection for in-cluster vs kubeconfig auth
description:
## Task T026

**Phase**: 3 - US2 K8s Secrets Backend
**User Story**: US2 - Kubernetes Secrets Backend (P0)
**Parallel**: No

### Description

Add auto-detection for in-cluster vs kubeconfig auth in plugins/floe-secrets-k8s/src/floe_secrets_k8s/plugin.py

### Logic

1. If `kubeconfig_path` provided, use kubeconfig
2. Else check for in-cluster service account (KUBERNETES_SERVICE_HOST env)
3. If in-cluster, use `load_incluster_config()`
4. Else fall back to `load_kube_config()` (default kubeconfig)

### File(s)

`plugins/floe-secrets-k8s/src/floe_secrets_k8s/plugin.py`

### Requirements

* FR-013: K8sSecretsPlugin MUST support both in-cluster and kubeconfig-based authentication

### Links

* [Spec](https://github.com/Obsidian-Owl/floe/blob/main/specs/7a-identity-secrets/spec.md)

description:
## Phase 5: User Story 3

Create **main**.py for module execution via `python -m testing.traceability`.

### File

`testing/traceability/__main__.py`

### Implementation

```python
"""Allow running traceability checker as module.

Usage:
    python -m testing.traceability --all --threshold 100
"""
from testing.traceability.checker import main

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
```

### Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Module can be run via python -m
- [ ] Passes arguments to main()
- [ ] Has docstring explaining usage

* Feature: 9c-testing-infra

title: T064: Implement JWKSCache for token validation performance
description:
## Task T064

**Phase**: 6 - US4 OAuth2/OIDC Authentication
**User Story**: US4 - OAuth2/OIDC Authentication (P1)
**Parallel**: No

### Description

Implement JWKSCache for token validation performance in plugins/floe-identity-keycloak/src/floe_identity_keycloak/jwks_cache.py

### Cache Requirements

* TTL: 1 hour (configurable)
* Thread-safe access
* Refresh on cache miss
* Refresh on signature verification failure

### Implementation

```python
class JWKSCache:
    def __init__(self, jwks_uri: str, ttl_seconds: int = 3600):
        self._jwks_uri = jwks_uri
        self._ttl = ttl_seconds
        self._cache: dict[str, Any] | None = None
        self._expires_at: float = 0
    
    def get_signing_key(self, kid: str) -> Any:
        if self._is_expired():
            self._refresh()
        return self._cache.get(kid)
```

### File(s)

`plugins/floe-identity-keycloak/src/floe_identity_keycloak/jwks_cache.py`

### Requirements

* SC-005: Token validation latency under 50ms with cached JWKS

### Links

* [Spec](https://github.com/Obsidian-Owl/floe/blob/main/specs/7a-identity-secrets/spec.md)

`testing/fixtures/polling.py`

### Implementation

```python
from pydantic import BaseModel, Field

class PollingConfig(BaseModel):
    """Configuration for polling utilities."""
    timeout: float = Field(default=30.0, ge=0.0, description="Max wait time in seconds")
    interval: float = Field(default=0.5, ge=0.1, description="Poll interval in seconds")
    description: str = Field(default="condition", description="Description for error messages")
```

### Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] PollingConfig Pydantic model created
- [ ] Sensible defaults (30s timeout, 0.5s interval)
- [ ] Type hints on all fields

title: Add Jaeger to test infrastructure for OpenTelemetry integration tests
description:
## Summary

Deploy Jaeger all-in-one to Kind cluster test infrastructure. The manifest file `testing/k8s/services/jaeger.yaml` already exists with proper configuration, but is not deployed by `setup-cluster.sh`.

## Problem

The Jaeger integration tests in `plugins/floe-telemetry-jaeger/tests/integration/` require a running Jaeger collector, but Jaeger is not currently deployed as part of the test infrastructure.

## Current State

**jaeger.yaml** exists with:

* Image: `jaegertracing/all-in-one:1.53`
* OTLP enabled: ports 4317 (gRPC), 4318 (HTTP)
* In-memory storage (appropriate for testing)
* Query UI on port 16686 with NodePort 30686

**Missing from **[**setup-cluster.sh**](http://setup-cluster.sh):

* Jaeger deployment command
* Wait for Jaeger in services array
* Jaeger URL in print_info output

**Missing from kind-config.yaml**:

* Port mapping for Jaeger Query UI (30686→16686)

## Implementation

1. Add Jaeger port mapping to `kind-config.yaml`
2. Update `deploy_services()` to deploy Jaeger
3. Add "jaeger" to `wait_for_services()` array
4. Update `print_info()` to show Jaeger URL

## Files to Modify

* `testing/k8s/kind-config.yaml`
* `testing/k8s/setup-cluster.sh`

## Verification

```bash
kind delete cluster --name floe-test
./testing/k8s/setup-cluster.sh
kubectl get pods -n floe-test -l app=jaeger
curl -s http://localhost:16686/ | head -1
pytest plugins/floe-telemetry-jaeger/tests/integration/ -v
```

## Requirement

FR-029: Jaeger backend for production tracing

title: T052: Implement health_check() verifying Infisical connectivity
description:
## Task T052

**Phase**: 5 - US3 Infisical Secrets Backend
**User Story**: US3 - Infisical Secrets Backend (P1)
**Parallel**: No

### Description

Implement health_check() verifying Infisical connectivity in plugins/floe-secrets-infisical/src/floe_secrets_infisical/plugin.py

### Implementation

```python
def health_check(self) -> HealthStatus:
    try:
        # Try to list secrets (limited)
        self._client.secrets.list_secrets(
            project_id=self._config.project_id,
            environment_slug=self._config.environment,
            secret_path=self._config.path
        )
        return HealthStatus(state=HealthState.HEALTHY)
    except Exception as e:
        return HealthStatus(state=HealthState.UNHEALTHY, message=str(e))
```

### File(s)

`plugins/floe-secrets-infisical/src/floe_secrets_infisical/plugin.py`

### Requirements

* CR-002: health_check() MUST return within 5 seconds

### Links

* [Spec](https://github.com/Obsidian-Owl/floe/blob/main/specs/7a-identity-secrets/spec.md)

title: T053: Add support for self-hosted and cloud Infisical URLs
description:
## Task T053

**Phase**: 5 - US3 Infisical Secrets Backend
**User Story**: US3 - Infisical Secrets Backend (P1)
**Parallel**: No

### Description

Add support for self-hosted and cloud Infisical URLs in plugins/floe-secrets-infisical/src/floe_secrets_infisical/config.py

### URL Options

* Cloud: `https://app.infisical.com` (default)
* Self-hosted: `https://infisical.company.com`

### Implementation

```python
class InfisicalSecretsConfig(BaseModel):
    site_url: str = Field(
        default="https://app.infisical.com",
        description="Infisical site URL (cloud or self-hosted)"
    )
    
    @field_validator("site_url")
    @classmethod
    def validate_url(cls, v: str) -> str:
        if not v.startswith("https://"):
            raise ValueError("site_url must use HTTPS")
        return v.rstrip("/")
```

### File(s)

`plugins/floe-secrets-infisical/src/floe_secrets_infisical/config.py`

### Links

* [Spec](https://github.com/Obsidian-Owl/floe/blob/main/specs/7a-identity-secrets/spec.md)

title: T024: Create testing/Dockerfile per research.md specification
description:
## Phase 3: User Story 1

Create test runner Dockerfile per [research.md](http://research.md) specification.

### File

`testing/Dockerfile`

### Dockerfile

```dockerfile
FROM python:3.12-slim

ENV PYTHONUNBUFFERED=1 \
    PYTHONDONTWRITEBYTECODE=1 \
    PATH="/opt/venv/bin:$PATH"

# Install uv
RUN pip install --no-cache-dir uv

WORKDIR /app

# Create venv (non-portable, must be created in container)
RUN python -m venv /opt/venv --upgrade-deps

# Copy and install dependencies
COPY pyproject.toml uv.lock ./
RUN uv pip sync uv.lock

# Copy source
COPY . .

# Artifacts directory
RUN mkdir -p /artifacts && chmod 777 /artifacts

ENTRYPOINT ["pytest"]
CMD ["tests/", "-v", "--junitxml=/artifacts/results.xml"]
```

### Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Multi-stage build with uv
- [ ] pytest as entrypoint
- [ ] JUnit XML output to /artifacts
- [ ] Image builds successfully
- [ ] Image size < 500MB

### Spec Reference

* Feature: 9c-testing-infra
* Phase: 3 (US1 - Kind Cluster)
* FR-004a: System MUST provide test-runner container image

title: [US6] Use list_namespaces() as lightweight health probe
description:
**Task ID**: T068
**User Story**: US6 - Platform Operator Monitors Catalog Health
**File**: `plugins/floe-catalog-polaris/src/floe_catalog_polaris/plugin.py`

Use list_namespaces() as the lightweight health probe operation.

**Rationale**:

* list_namespaces() is fast and always available

title: T068: Implement validate_token() with JWKS verification
description:
## Task T068

**Phase**: 6 - US4 OAuth2/OIDC Authentication
**User Story**: US4 - OAuth2/OIDC Authentication (P1)
**Parallel**: No

### Description

Implement validate_token() with JWKS verification in plugins/floe-identity-keycloak/src/floe_identity_keycloak/plugin.py

### Implementation

```python
def validate_token(self, token: str) -> TokenValidationResult:
    try:
        # Get key ID from token header
        header = jwt.get_unverified_header(token)
        kid = header.get("kid")
        
        # Get signing key from cache
        key = self._jwks_cache.get_signing_key(kid)
        
        # Verify token
        claims = jwt.decode(
            token,
            key,
            algorithms=["RS256"],
            audience=self._config.client_id,
            issuer=f"{self._config.server_url}/realms/{self._config.realm}"
        )
        
        return TokenValidationResult(
            valid=True,
            user_info=self._extract_user_info(claims),
            expires_at=datetime.fromtimestamp(claims["exp"])
        )
    except jwt.ExpiredSignatureError:
        return TokenValidationResult(valid=False, error="Token expired")
    except jwt.InvalidTokenError as e:
        return TokenValidationResult(valid=False, error=str(e))
```

### File(s)

`plugins/floe-identity-keycloak/src/floe_identity_keycloak/plugin.py`

### Requirements

* FR-034: KeycloakPlugin MUST validate JWT tokens using JWKS
* FR-041: TokenValidationResult dataclass

### Links

* [Spec](https://github.com/Obsidian-Owl/floe/blob/main/specs/7a-identity-secrets/spec.md)

title: T066: Implement authenticate() for credential exchange
description:
## Task T066

**Phase**: 6 - US4 OAuth2/OIDC Authentication
**User Story**: US4 - OAuth2/OIDC Authentication (P1)
**Parallel**: No

### Description

Implement authenticate() for credential exchange in plugins/floe-identity-keycloak/src/floe_identity_keycloak/plugin.py

### Supported Credential Types

* `client_credentials`: client_id + client_secret
* `password`: username + password (for testing only)
* `refresh_token`: refresh existing token

### Implementation

```python
def authenticate(self, credentials: dict[str, Any]) -> str:
    grant_type = credentials.get("grant_type", "client_credentials")
    if grant_type == "client_credentials":
        token = self._openid.token(
            grant_type="client_credentials",
            client_id=self._config.client_id,
            client_secret=self._config.client_secret.get_secret_value()
        )
    return token["access_token"]
```

### File(s)

`plugins/floe-identity-keycloak/src/floe_identity_keycloak/plugin.py`

### Requirements

* FR-001: IdentityPlugin ABC with authenticate()

### Links

* [Spec](https://github.com/Obsidian-Owl/floe/blob/main/specs/7a-identity-secrets/spec.md)

* Handle token expiry

**Priority**: P3

title: T025: Implement sync command in cli.py
description:
**Task ID**: T025
**Phase**: 5 - US4 (Git Hook Integration)
**User Story**: US4
**Parallel**: No

## Description

Implement `sync` command in `cli.py`:

* Accept `--files` argument (optional, specific files)
* Accept `--all` flag (sync all, not just changed)
* Accept `--dry-run` flag (report what would sync)
* If no files specified, detect from git diff
* For each changed file:
  * If markdown: parse and `cognee.add()`
  * If Python: extract docstrings and `cognee.codify()`
* Call `cognee.cognify()` for affected datasets
* Update `SyncState` and file checksums

## Files

* `devtools/agent-memory/src/agent_memory/cli.py`

## Acceptance Criteria

* `agent-memory sync` syncs changed files
* Dry run shows what would be synced
* State and checksums updated correctly

## Requirements

* FR-009: Git hooks trigger sync on post-commit
* FR-012: Track files that need sync

title: T039: Update compiler to use SecretReference for profiles.yml generation
description:
## Task T039

**Phase**: 4 - US1 SecretReference Runtime Resolution
**User Story**: US1 - SecretReference Runtime Resolution (P0)
**Parallel**: No

### Description

Update compiler to use SecretReference for profiles.yml generation in packages/floe-core/src/floe_core/compiler/

### Behavior

When manifest has:

```yaml
connections:
  snowflake:
    connection_secret_ref: snowflake-credentials
```

Compiler should generate profiles.yml with:

```yaml
snowflake:
  target: dev
  outputs:
    dev:
      type: snowflake
      password: "{{ env_var('FLOE_SECRET_SNOWFLAKE_CREDENTIALS_PASSWORD') }}"
```

### File(s)

`packages/floe-core/src/floe_core/compiler/`

### Requirements

* FR-050: Convert SecretReference to env_var() syntax

### Links

* [Spec](https://github.com/Obsidian-Owl/floe/blob/main/specs/7a-identity-secrets/spec.md)

description:
## Phase 7: User Story 5 - CI Workflow Updates (P1)

Add security scanning job to CI workflow.

### File

`.github/workflows/ci.yml`

### Job

```yaml
security:
  runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    - name: Set up Python
      uses: actions/setup-python@v5
    - name: Run Bandit
      run: bandit -r packages/ -ll
    - name: Run pip-audit
      run: pip-audit
```

### Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Security job added to ci.yml
- [ ] Bandit scans all packages
- [ ] pip-audit checks dependencies
- [ ] Job runs in parallel with unit-tests

title: T012: Create testing/fixtures/namespaces.py with generate_unique_namespace()
description:
## Phase 2: Foundational (Blocking Prerequisites)

Create `testing/fixtures/namespaces.py` with unique namespace generation.

### File

`testing/fixtures/namespaces.py`

### Function Signature

```python
def generate_unique_namespace(prefix: str = "test") -> str:
    """Generate a unique K8s namespace name.
    
    Args:
        prefix: Namespace prefix (e.g., "test_polaris")
        
    Returns:
        Unique namespace string (e.g., "test_polaris_a1b2c3d4")
        
    Notes:
        - Uses UUID suffix for uniqueness
        - K8s namespace naming rules: lowercase, alphanumeric, hyphens
        - Max 63 characters
    """
```

### Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Generates unique namespace per call
- [ ] Follows K8s naming conventions
- [ ] Max 63 characters
- [ ] Uses UUID or timestamp suffix

### Spec Reference

* Feature: 9c-testing-infra
* Phase: 2 (Foundational)
* FR-008: Base classes MUST generate unique namespaces per test

title: T014: Create testing/fixtures/services.py with check_service_health()
description:
## Phase 2: Foundational (Blocking Prerequisites)

Create `testing/fixtures/services.py` with service health check utility.

### File

`testing/fixtures/services.py`

### Function Signature

```python
def check_service_health(
    service_name: str,
    port: int,
    namespace: str = "floe-test",
    timeout: float = 5.0
) -> bool:
    """Check if a K8s service is healthy.
    
    Args:
        service_name: Name of the K8s service
        port: Port to check
        namespace: K8s namespace
        timeout: Connection timeout
        
    Returns:
        True if service responds, False otherwise
    """
```

### Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] TCP connection check to service
- [ ] Returns True/False (no exceptions for unhealthy)
- [ ] Respects timeout
- [ ] Works with K8s service DNS

### Spec Reference

* Feature: 9c-testing-infra
* Phase: 2 (Foundational)
* FR-005: IntegrationTestBase with service availability checks

title: T035: Implement TraceabilityReport Pydantic model
description:
## Phase 5: User Story 3

Implement TraceabilityReport Pydantic model in `testing/traceability/checker.py`.

### File

`testing/traceability/checker.py`

### Model

```python
from pydantic import BaseModel, Field

class TraceabilityReport(BaseModel):
    """Traceability report for requirement coverage."""
    
    total_tests: int = Field(..., description="Total number of tests")
    tests_with_markers: int = Field(..., description="Tests with requirement markers")
    tests_without_markers: list[str] = Field(default_factory=list)
    requirements: dict[str, list[str]] = Field(default_factory=dict)
    coverage_percent: float = Field(..., ge=0.0, le=100.0)
    
    @property
    def passed(self) -> bool:
        """Check if coverage meets threshold."""
        return self.coverage_percent >= 100.0
```

### Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Pydantic model created
- [ ] All fields documented
- [ ] JSON serializable
- [ ] coverage_percent calculation correct

### Spec Reference

* Feature: 9c-testing-infra
* Phase: 5 (US3 - Traceability)
* FR-019: System MUST provide traceability report generation

title: T049: Implement LRU eviction
description:
## Task

\[US6\] Implement LRU eviction when cache exceeds max_size.

**Implementation**:

* `get_lru_entries()` - Return least recently used immutable entries
* `evict()` - Remove entries to bring cache under max size
* Only evict immutable entries (mutable expire via TTL)

**Requirements covered**: FR-016

**Implementation notes**:

* Track last_accessed timestamp on every get
* Sort by last_accessed ascending for LRU
* Default max_size: 10GB (configurable)

**Phase**: 8 (User Story 6 - Local Caching)
**Priority**: P3

title: T056: Document InfisicalSecret CRD integration in quickstart.md
description:
## Task T056

**Phase**: 5 - US3 Infisical Secrets Backend
**User Story**: US3 - Infisical Secrets Backend (P1)
**Parallel**: No

### Description

Document InfisicalSecret CRD integration in specs/7a-identity-secrets/quickstart.md

### Content

1. Prerequisites (Infisical Operator installed)
2. Creating InfisicalSecret CRD
3. Configuring auto-reload annotation
4. Example manifest.yaml configuration
5. Verifying sync to K8s Secret

### Example InfisicalSecret CRD

```yaml
apiVersion: secrets.infisical.com/v1alpha1
kind: InfisicalSecret
metadata:
  name: snowflake-credentials
  annotations:
    secrets.infisical.com/auto-reload: "true"
spec:
  hostAPI: https://app.infisical.com
  authentication:
    universalAuth:
      secretsScope:
        projectSlug: my-project
        envSlug: production
        secretsPath: /compute/snowflake
```

### File(s)

`specs/7a-identity-secrets/quickstart.md`

### Requirements

* FR-022: InfisicalSecretsPlugin MUST integrate with Infisical K8s Operator
* FR-023: InfisicalSecretsPlugin MUST support auto-reload

### Links

title: T050: Implement set_secret() for secret creation/updates
description:
## Task T050

**Phase**: 5 - US3 Infisical Secrets Backend
**User Story**: US3 - Infisical Secrets Backend (P1)
**Parallel**: No

### Description

Implement set_secret() for secret creation/updates in plugins/floe-secrets-infisical/src/floe_secrets_infisical/plugin.py

### Implementation

```python
def set_secret(self, key: str, value: str, metadata: dict | None = None) -> None:
    # Try to update existing
    try:
        self._client.secrets.update_secret_by_name(...)
    except NotFoundError:
        # Create new if not exists
        self._client.secrets.create_secret(...)
```

### File(s)

`plugins/floe-secrets-infisical/src/floe_secrets_infisical/plugin.py`

### Requirements

* FR-002: set_secret() creates or updates

title: T022: Create testing/k8s/setup-cluster.sh for cluster creation
description:
## Phase 3: User Story 1

Create cluster setup script for Kind cluster creation.

### File

`testing/k8s/setup-cluster.sh`

### Script Contents

```bash
#!/bin/bash
set -euo pipefail

SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
CLUSTER_NAME="${CLUSTER_NAME:-floe-test}"

echo "Creating Kind cluster: $CLUSTER_NAME"
kind create cluster --name "$CLUSTER_NAME" --config "$SCRIPT_DIR/kind-config.yaml"

echo "Applying service manifests..."
kubectl apply -f "$SCRIPT_DIR/services/"

echo "Waiting for services to be ready..."
kubectl wait --for=condition=ready pods --all -n floe-test --timeout=120s

echo "Cluster ready!"
kubectl get pods -n floe-test
```

### Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Script creates Kind cluster
- [ ] Applies all service manifests
- [ ] Waits for pods to be ready
- [ ] Exits with error on failure
- [ ] Uses set -euo pipefail

### Spec Reference

* Feature: 9c-testing-infra
* Phase: 3 (US1 - Kind Cluster)
* FR-003: System MUST support cluster creation via make kind-up

title: REQ-528: Register MarquezLineageBackendPlugin entry point
description:
## Problem

The `MarquezLineageBackendPlugin` class exists at `packages/floe-core/src/floe_core/lineage/backends/marquez.py` but cannot be discovered via the standard plugin entry point mechanism.

* Plugin class inherits from `LineageBackendPlugin` ABC
* No `[project.entry-points."floe.lineage_backends"]` registration exists
* Plugin discovery via `importlib.metadata.entry_points()` will not find it

## Requirement

REQ-528: Marquez integration (HIGH priority) - part of Epic 6B OpenLineage scope.

## Options

### Option A: Create dedicated plugin package (Recommended)

1. Create `plugins/floe-lineage-marquez/` package structure
2. Move `floe_core/lineage/backends/marquez.py` to the new plugin package
3. Add entry point: `marquez = "floe_lineage_marquez:MarquezLineageBackendPlugin"`
4. Update imports in floe-core
5. Add plugin discovery tests

### Option B: Register in floe-core directly

Keep in floe-core as a built-in backend with entry point in floe-core's pyproject.toml.

### Option C: Document as direct import only

No entry point discovery - users import directly. Document limitation.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] `MarquezLineageBackendPlugin` discoverable via entry points OR documented as direct-import-only
- [ ] Plugin discovery tests pass
- [ ] Integration with lineage backend registry works

title: T016: Create testing/k8s/kind-config.yaml per research.md specification
description:
## Phase 3: User Story 1 - Kind Cluster Setup (P0 MVP)

Create Kind cluster configuration file per [research.md](http://research.md) specification.

### File

`testing/k8s/kind-config.yaml`

### Configuration

```yaml
kind: Cluster
apiVersion: kind.x-k8s.io/v1alpha4
name: floe-test
nodes:
  - role: control-plane
    image: kindest/node:v1.29.0
    kubeadmConfigPatches:
      - |
        kind: KubeletConfiguration
        systemReserved:
          cpu: 100m
          memory: 100Mi
        kubeReserved:
          cpu: 50m
          memory: 50Mi
networking:
  podSubnet: "10.244.0.0/16"
  serviceSubnet: "10.96.0.0/16"
  kubeProxyMode: iptables
```

### Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Kind config file created
- [ ] Pinned Kind node version (v1.29.0)
- [ ] Resource reservations configured
- [ ] Networking configured

### Spec Reference

* Feature: 9c-testing-infra
* Phase: 3 (US1 - Kind Cluster)
* FR-001: System MUST provide Kind cluster configuration

title: T025: Add cache lookup before network request
description:
## Task

\[US2\] Add cache lookup before network request.

**Implementation**:

* Check cache for existing entry by digest
* Validate TTL for mutable tags
* Return cached content if valid
* Skip network request on cache hit

**Requirements covered**: FR-013, FR-014, FR-015

**Implementation notes**:

* Immutable tags (semver) cached indefinitely
* Mutable tags have configurable TTL (default 24h)
* Verify digest before returning cached content

**Phase**: 4 (User Story 2 - Pull Artifacts)
**Priority**: P1 MVP

title: T031: Implement health_check() verifying K8s API connectivity
description:
## Task T031

**Phase**: 3 - US2 K8s Secrets Backend
**User Story**: US2 - Kubernetes Secrets Backend (P0)
**Parallel**: No

### Description

Implement health_check() verifying K8s API connectivity in plugins/floe-secrets-k8s/src/floe_secrets_k8s/plugin.py

### Implementation

```python
def health_check(self) -> HealthStatus:
    try:
        # Try to list secrets (limited to 1)
        self._api.list_namespaced_secret(namespace=self._config.namespace, limit=1)
        return HealthStatus(state=HealthState.HEALTHY)
    except ApiException as e:
        return HealthStatus(state=HealthState.UNHEALTHY, message=str(e))
```

### File(s)

`plugins/floe-secrets-k8s/src/floe_secrets_k8s/plugin.py`

### Requirements

* CR-002: health_check() MUST return within 5 seconds

### Links

* [Spec](https://github.com/Obsidian-Owl/floe/blob/main/specs/7a-identity-secrets/spec.md)

* Use non-blocking lock with retry for reads

description:
## Task

Implement compile orchestrator executing 6-stage pipeline in packages/floe-core/src/floe_core/compilation/stages.py

User Story 1 - Implementation (Phase 3)

US1 - Compile Data Product Configuration

* T021 (CompilationStage enum)

description:
## Task

\[US2\] Implement `floe artifact pull` CLI command in `packages/floe-core/src/floe_core/cli/artifact.py`.

**Implementation**:

* Accept `--tag` (target tag to pull)
* Accept `--output` (output directory path)
* Read registry configuration from manifest.yaml
* Output progress and final path

**Requirements covered**: FR-027

**CLI examples**:

```bash
floe artifact pull --tag v1.0.0 --output ./artifacts/
floe artifact pull --tag latest-dev --output ./artifacts/
```

**Exit codes**:

* 0: Success
* 1: General error
* 2: Authentication error
* 3: Artifact not found
* 5: Network/connectivity error

**Phase**: 4 (User Story 2 - Pull Artifacts)
**Priority**: P1 MVP

```python
class K8sSecretsPlugin(SecretsPlugin):
    name = "k8s"
    version = "1.0.0"
    floe_api_version = "1.0"
    
    def __init__(self, config: K8sSecretsConfig): ...
    def get_secret(self, key: str) -> str | None: ...
    def set_secret(self, key: str, value: str, metadata: dict | None = None) -> None: ...
    def list_secrets(self, prefix: str = "") -> list[str]: ...
```

`plugins/floe-secrets-k8s/src/floe_secrets_k8s/plugin.py`

title: T047: Implement InfisicalSecretsPlugin with infisicalsdk
description:
## Task T047

**Phase**: 5 - US3 Infisical Secrets Backend
**User Story**: US3 - Infisical Secrets Backend (P1)
**Parallel**: No

### Description

Implement InfisicalSecretsPlugin with infisicalsdk in plugins/floe-secrets-infisical/src/floe_secrets_infisical/plugin.py

### Class Structure

```python
class InfisicalSecretsPlugin(SecretsPlugin):
    name = "infisical"
    version = "1.0.0"
    floe_api_version = "1.0"
    
    def __init__(self, config: InfisicalSecretsConfig): ...
    def get_secret(self, key: str) -> str | None: ...
    def set_secret(self, key: str, value: str, metadata: dict | None = None) -> None: ...
    def list_secrets(self, prefix: str = "") -> list[str]: ...
```

### SDK Usage

```python
from infisical_sdk import InfisicalSDKClient

client = InfisicalSDKClient(host=config.site_url)
client.auth.universal_auth.login(
    client_id=config.client_id,
    client_secret=config.client_secret.get_secret_value()
)
```

`plugins/floe-secrets-infisical/src/floe_secrets_infisical/plugin.py`

title: Add metrics-server and monitoring stack to Kind test cluster
description:
## Summary

Enhance Kind test cluster configuration for better developer experience with Lens and monitoring.

## Changes Required

1. **Metrics Server** - Install with `--kubelet-insecure-tls` for Kind compatibility
2. **Enhanced Kind Config** - Add extraPortMappings for service access, expose control plane metrics
3. **kube-prometheus-stack** - Full Prometheus + Grafana + AlertManager stack

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] `kubectl top nodes` and `kubectl top pods` work
- [ ] Lens shows resource metrics (CPU/memory) for pods and nodes
- [ ] Services accessible via localhost (Polaris:8181, Dagster:3000, MinIO:9000)
- [ ] Prometheus and Grafana dashboards accessible
- [ ] Setup script (`make kind-up`) deploys everything automatically

## Context

Found during Epic 9C pre-PR review - Lens shows "Metrics are not available due to missing or invalid configuration."

## References

* [metrics-server on Kind](https://gist.github.com/sanketsudake/a089e691286bf2189bfedf295222bd43)
* [kube-prometheus-stack](https://github.com/prometheus-community/helm-charts/tree/main/charts/kube-prometheus-stack)

### Sample Test

```python
from testing.base_classes.integration_test_base import IntegrationTestBase
import pytest


class TestSampleIntegration(IntegrationTestBase):
    """Sample integration test demonstrating base class usage."""
    
    required_services = [("postgres", 5432)]
    
    @pytest.mark.requirement("9c-FR-005")
    def test_service_connectivity(self) -> None:
        """Test that required services are accessible."""
        # Service check happens automatically in setup
        namespace = self.generate_unique_namespace("sample")
        assert namespace.startswith("sample-")
```

### Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Sample test created
- [ ] Demonstrates IntegrationTestBase usage
- [ ] Has @pytest.mark.requirement() marker
- [ ] Can run with Kind cluster

### Spec Reference

* Feature: 9c-testing-infra
* Phase: 4 (US2 - Base Classes)
* Parallel: Yes

title: Create ComputePlugin test fixtures (REQ-025)
description:
## REQ-025: ComputePlugin Test Fixtures

**Requirement**: System MUST provide test fixtures for ComputePlugin implementations that extend the Epic 9C testing framework.

**Rationale**: Integration tests for compute adapters (Snowflake, BigQuery, Spark) require database connectivity fixtures to validate profile generation, query execution, and resource management.

### Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Fixture module: `testing/fixtures/compute.py` (extends 9C patterns)
- [ ] `ComputeTestConfig(BaseModel)` with `frozen=True`
- [ ] Context manager: `compute_connection_context()` for lifecycle
- [ ] Adapter-specific fixtures: `snowflake_fixture()`, `bigquery_fixture()`, `spark_fixture()`
- [ ] Mock fixtures for unit tests (no real database required)
- [ ] Extends: `IntegrationTestBase` from Epic 9C
- [ ] Type hints: mypy --strict passes
- [ ] Test coverage: >80% of fixture code

### Constraints

* MUST extend Epic 9C testing framework (`testing.base_classes`)
* MUST follow fixture pattern from `testing/fixtures/__init__.py`
* MUST use Pydantic v2 `ConfigDict(frozen=True)` for config
* MUST NOT duplicate DuckDB fixture from Epic 9C (reference implementation)
* MUST support credential injection via environment variables

### Files

* `testing/fixtures/compute.py`
* `testing/tests/unit/test_compute_fixtures.py`

### Traceability

* Epic 9C (Testing Framework dependency)
* Epic 4A (ComputePlugin)
* ADR-0065 (K8s-native testing)

title: T039: Create testing/fixtures/conftest.py with pytest hooks for marker collection
description:
## Phase 5: User Story 3

Create [conftest.py](http://conftest.py) with pytest hooks for requirement marker collection.

### File

`testing/fixtures/conftest.py`

### Implementation

```python
import pytest

def pytest_collection_finish(session: pytest.Session) -> None:
    """Collect requirement markers after test collection.
    
    This hook runs after pytest has collected all tests.
    It extracts @pytest.mark.requirement() markers for traceability.
    """
    from testing.traceability.checker import collect_requirements
    
    # Store in session for later use
    session.requirement_map = collect_requirements(session)
```

### Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Hook registered in [conftest.py](http://conftest.py)
- [ ] Collects markers after collection
- [ ] Stores map in session object
- [ ] Does not affect test execution

### Spec Reference

* Feature: 9c-testing-infra
* Phase: 5 (US3 - Traceability)
* FR-018: @pytest.mark.requirement() marker

title: T025: Create testing/k8s/jobs/test-runner.yaml K8s Job manifest
description:
## Phase 3: User Story 1 \[P - Parallelizable\]

Create K8s Job manifest for test runner execution.

### File

`testing/k8s/jobs/test-runner.yaml`

### Manifest

```yaml
apiVersion: batch/v1
kind: Job
metadata:
  name: integration-tests
  namespace: floe-test
spec:
  backoffLimit: 0
  template:
    spec:
      restartPolicy: Never
      containers:
      - name: test-runner
        image: floe-test-runner:latest
        args: ["tests/integration/", "-v", "--junitxml=/artifacts/results.xml"]
        volumeMounts:
        - name: artifacts
          mountPath: /artifacts
      volumes:
      - name: artifacts
        emptyDir:
          sizeLimit: 1Gi
```

title: T070: Implement health_check() verifying Keycloak connectivity
description:
## Task T070

**Phase**: 6 - US4 OAuth2/OIDC Authentication
**User Story**: US4 - OAuth2/OIDC Authentication (P1)
**Parallel**: No

### Description

Implement health_check() verifying Keycloak connectivity in plugins/floe-identity-keycloak/src/floe_identity_keycloak/plugin.py

### Implementation

```python
def health_check(self) -> HealthStatus:
    try:
        # Fetch OIDC discovery endpoint
        response = httpx.get(
            f"{self._config.server_url}/realms/{self._config.realm}/.well-known/openid-configuration",
            timeout=5.0
        )
        response.raise_for_status()
        return HealthStatus(state=HealthState.HEALTHY)
    except Exception as e:
        return HealthStatus(state=HealthState.UNHEALTHY, message=str(e))
```

### File(s)

`plugins/floe-identity-keycloak/src/floe_identity_keycloak/plugin.py`

### Requirements

* CR-002: health_check() MUST return within 5 seconds

### Links

* [Spec](https://github.com/Obsidian-Owl/floe/blob/main/specs/7a-identity-secrets/spec.md)

title: T038: Add multi-key secret support to SecretReference
description:
## Task T038

**Phase**: 4 - US1 SecretReference Runtime Resolution
**User Story**: US1 - SecretReference Runtime Resolution (P0)
**Parallel**: No

### Description

Add multi-key secret support to SecretReference in packages/floe-core/src/floe_core/schemas/secrets.py

### Multi-Key Pattern

K8s Secrets can have multiple keys:

```yaml
apiVersion: v1
kind: Secret
metadata:
  name: db-creds
data:
  username: YWRtaW4=
  password: cGFzc3dvcmQ=
  host: ZGIuZXhhbXBsZS5jb20=
```

SecretReference should support:

```python
ref = SecretReference(name="db-creds", key="password")  # Specific key
ref = SecretReference(name="db-creds")  # All keys
```

### File(s)

`packages/floe-core/src/floe_core/schemas/secrets.py`

### Requirements

* FR-052: System MUST support multi-key secrets

### Links

* [Spec](https://github.com/Obsidian-Owl/floe/blob/main/specs/7a-identity-secrets/spec.md)
